newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romanian state budget gap rises in August.
newsitem.headline: Romanian state budget gap rises in August.

text.p: Romania's state budget deficit widened in August, pushing the eight-month figure to 1.9 trillion lei from 1.66 trillion lei over January-July, official data showed on Tuesday.

Eight-month spending stood at 12.99 trillion lei, up from 11.29 trillion lei at end-July, while state revenues went up to 11.09 trillion lei at end-August, from 9.63 trillion over January-July, a central bank report said.
It gave no other details and no dollar equivalent. On Tuesday the leu's reference rate was 3,262 to the dollar.
Under a revised version of the state budget, the gap is envisaged at 4.27 trillion lei for the whole year, against a previous estimate of 3.19 trillion.
State expenditure for 1996 is put at 24.14 trillion lei and revenues at 19.87 trillion. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
